replies.body: So wait, we nerffed Sona. Made her mana costs extreme, Increased the costs of tear, reduced shields. increased mana costs and gold costs. Riot, Some people like to play support. I really enjoy it. But you are making it so that AP supports are totally useless. They have no sustain, no items and no gold. This is getting to the point where supports are irrelevant till 15 mins and then they are behind for the remainder of the game. I love my Sona, I played her alot and now, I cant even use her mid lane... you guys need to stop breaking everything and focus more an a game wide balance. You're forcing another Tank meta and gutting everyone else.
The team with more Ornns will win

I understand the shield nerfs but why nerf shield duration and forbidden idle at the same time. I'm gonna miss feeling almost relevant stat wise on Support.

For Janna with the shield decaying its gonna be really easy to remove it making the ADC lose the bonus AD.
For Karma you needed a long shield duration for R + E combo to feel like the shield and mini shields weren't wasted if you used them to give MS to team to reposition in fights. Now if you use them to deny burst (rather than to shield burst) or for the MS you are losing about 80% of your mid-late game effectiveness. Since all you have left is a small Q poke and sub par delayed CC E root.

I understand shields shouldn't last the whole duration of fights and things like lulu having a 6s shield every 5.5s doesn't make sense.

I'm not liking the direction league is headed where its becoming directed to people with elite reaction speed.

I play on 50ms and I struggle compete with those on 0ms ping.

All champs and items these days are becoming more and more skill reliant. Easy champs/items need to exist too for the players with good Macro but not Micro or players forced into off role or even just because some people enjoy outwitting their opponent over out playing them. Not all players aim to be flashy, some aim for consistency.

I'm just salty my favorite supports are likely to not be meta anymore, I'll be back on tanks. Atleast there is always Taric to fall back on.

Where are the {{champion:119}} bug fixes???? Hes been bugged for the last 2 years. Ohh...wait Caitlyn skin has a bug? We're gonna immediately bug fix it, o n it straight away. BIG BRAIN RIOT.

I reported a Blackfrost Anivia bug that I've been able to perform easily, that's been around longer than I've known it for. Nothing done.

/j whilst her spawn animation is playing, and it freezes until the spawn animation would finish, then it switches to the middle of her /j animation from the freeze.

Non gameplay affecting visual bugs are pretty much the lowest priority, one as minor as that even lower. Bugs that actively affect games, even if they're not reliable or all that repeatable are always going to be a higher priority. Bugs with brand new content will typically also be fixed quickly, because those are usually being actively monitored to ensure the best experience for their release.

Well every update, I see a heap of visual bugs being fixed, including a lot of old ones, but a bug would generally be random or very difficult to pull off, right? That Anivia bug has been around for so long, and it seems as easy to fix as it would be to perform it.

I never notice bugs in the game, ever. Maybe because most of them are details I don't pay much attention to.

Talking about brand new content, Veigar had a double stacking laugh for a while. If you're laughing and you ult kill someone to trigger an automatic laugh, he laughs over it. Then they released Omega Squad Veigar. Every single time I kill someone with his r, he laughs without the voice changer effect that's based on his skin.

The priority list would depend on a lot of things, I'm not going to pretend to know the specifics. Things like, how easy is it to fix, how easy is it to isolate the cause in the code, will it have to wait for the next patch to be shipped, how often does it come up etc etc.
